attributes.action: National Referendum on UK Immigration Policy
attributes.additional_details: Current immigration policy is failing to secure our borders, placing unsustainable pressure on public services (healthcare, education & housing) and eroding community safety. Citizens feel excluded from decisions affecting national security, resource allocations and the future of our country. A referendum is essential to empower the public and to restore trust and security.
attributes.background: We call for a national referendum for British citizens to directly determine UK Immigration policy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. There are no details about what options you would like the public to vote on in a referendum. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may also wish to sign the following petitions which call for a similar action:

Hold a referendum on stopping immigration into the UK for 30 years 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/730009

Immediately tighten immigration requirements 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727491
